abstract.p: Dunkin' Donuts unit of Allied Domecq names Hill, Holliday, Connors, Cosmopulos to handle its account, with billings estimated at $45 million; account had been handled by Messner Vetere Berger McNamee Schmetterer Euro RSCG; Outback Steakhouse Inc names TBWA Chiat/Day to handle creative portion of its account, with billings estimated to be as much as $35 million; account had been handled by McCann-Erickson New York (S)

block.p: A doughnut and a restaurant chain made changes on their accounts yesterday.

The Dunkin' Donuts unit of Allied Domecq in Randolph, Mass., named Hill, Holliday, Connors, Cosmopulos in Boston to handle its account, with billings estimated at $45 million. The account had been handled since October 1995 by Messner Vetere Berger McNamee Schmetterer Euro RSCG in New York, a unit of Havas Advertising, until that agency was dismissed last month.
A doughnut and a restaurant chain made changes on their accounts yesterday.

The Dunkin' Donuts unit of Allied Domecq in Randolph, Mass., named Hill, Holliday, Connors, Cosmopulos in Boston to handle its account, with billings estimated at $45 million. The account had been handled since October 1995 by Messner Vetere Berger McNamee Schmetterer Euro RSCG in New York, a unit of Havas Advertising, until that agency was dismissed last month.

Hill, Holliday, a unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies, was awarded the account after a monthlong review that also included one other agency: Deutsch Inc. in New York; Deutsch's Santa Monica, Calif., office handles advertising for the Baskin-Robbins unit of Allied Domecq.

And Outback Steakhouse Inc. in Tampa, Fla., named TBWA Chiat/ Day in New York to handle the creative portion of its account, with billings estimated to be as much as $35 million. The account had been handled by the McCann-Erickson New York unit of the McCann-Erickson World Group of the Interpublic Group of Companies, until that agency and Outback parted ways in December.

The decision came after a two-month review that included TBWA Chiat/Day, part of Omnicom Group, and Ground Zero in Santa Monica, Calif., and Partners & Shevack in New York, part of Mickelberry Communications. KSL Media Inc. and SFM Media Corporation, both of New York, handle the media portion of the account.
